name: SYSTM December Challenge: End Game
description:
#### **End Game**

**All in. All out. End the year like a pro.**

​

The year’s almost over — and this is your _final stage_.
December is where Wahooligans dig deep, light the jets, and leave nothing behind. “End Game” isn’t about pacing… it’s about pushing. It’s the final sprint, the last big effort, and your chance to close out 2025 with full-gas glory.

This month, we’re going out in style — with a mini race tour of four legendary SYSTM workouts designed to test your power, control, and courage under pressure.


You’ve built the base. Now it’s time to burn what’s left in the tank.

- **Cygnet Coast: **Smooth power, tactical patience, and the confidence to hold your line when it matters.
- **Attacker: **Go off the front, stay away, and feel what it’s like to race on instinct and guts.
- **Tour de Suisse Women – Stage 2: **Elevation, speed, and resilience — the perfect stage to empty the tank and finish the year in style.
- **The Wretched: **Relentless efforts, surges, and that glorious moment when you refuse to give in.

Find out more about the Wahoo X December Challenge

prospects.name: Tasmania: Cygnet Coast Road
prospects.description:
The setting might be one of stunning tranquility, but this workout certainly isn't. We're down in far, far Southern Tasmania for a ride along one of the most stunning - but little known - roads in the region. Starting in the hamlet of Cradoc, we head south along the peninsula to the village of Cygnet. It's a rolling road with countless little 'kickers' that we're going to hit at maximum intensity in order to simulate a race or hard group ride. Along the way, we'll pop in to visit some of the most interesting characters who call this area home: a winemaker, an artist, and the founder of a famous cooking school.

​

[Route on Strava](https://www.strava.com/routes/2927502558987635926)

​

_About your host: Who better to show you around Tasmania than Nicole Frain? Raised in the north of the island, and currently living just outside Hobart, Nicole knows all the best places to spend your time on and off the bike. Known for her aggressive racing, the Parkhotel-Valkenberg professional won the 2022 Australian Elite Road Race Championship with a late attack and also finished second overall at the 2022 Tour Down Under. Good luck staying with her as she takes you through these workouts!_

​

Featured in this video:

[Farmhouse Kitchen](https://www.thefarmhousekitchen-tas.com/)

[Sailor Seeks Horse](https://sailorseekshorse.com.au/)

[Matt Calvert](https://mattcalvert.com.au/)

prospects.name: Attacker
prospects.description:
Being able to finish strong comes from properly pacing your efforts and preparing to finish strong. This session is all about improving those abilities. For just over 50 minutes, you'll tackle five different 6-minute long, progressive efforts that start just below FTP and finish well above it for the final minute.

​

The real challenge of this workout is the limited 1-minute recovery sections between each effort. You’ll want to savor every second of those short recoveries. This workout will help improve your FTP and improve your ability to recover while pushing just under your threshold for the first half of each effort. You’ll also learn to manage your pacing and put out power above your threshold after holding steady just below that breakpoint.

​

Riders with sustained weakness will benefit greatly from this workout, as will anyone looking to push up their FTP.

_Attacker_ is quite similar to the SUF workout, _Defender._ However, the efforts within each interval are 2-minutes shorter, and instead of starting harder and backing off like in _Defender,_ the efforts in this session start controlled and keep squeezing harder and harder until the end.

prospects.name: Tour de Suisse Women 2
prospects.description:
**Featured rider: **Clara KOPPENBURG of Germany

**Event: **Tour de Suisse Women

​

After the racing in Vaduz as part of the Tour de Suisse Women, the peloton leaves Liechtenstein and heads towards Chur, the oldest town in Switzerland. With the riders having ridden 96 kilometers over some tough climbs already, you'll join the action on-board with Cofidis Professional Clara Koppenburg with less than 28 kilometers to go. The final climb of the day up to St Luzisteig is coming up. Be ready for plenty of attacks before you get there and a high pace once on the slopes. You have all to play for in this stage. Can you pull it off?

​

**About ProRides**

_Here’s your chance to experience what it’s like to ride in the biggest races in the world, thanks to SYSTM’s 4DP platform. We’ve taken the first-person camera footage and power data from a pro cyclist and analyzed it to determine which part of their 4DP® profile each of their efforts corresponds to. But since few of us can put down pro-level watts, we made it so all of the efforts are scaled to your own personal 4DP® profile. That means you get to experience exactly what the pros experience relative to your own abilities. When they sprint, you sprint. When they attack, you attack. When they sit up, you get to take it (relatively) easy. It's the most immersive, realistic race simulation out there._

​

[Here's some more information on how to create the most immersive ProRides experience.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterProRides)

prospects.name: The Wretched
prospects.description:
A SUF classic, this session is not for the faint of heart, or the fatigued of legs. What it may lack in polish it more than makes up for with results. With large continuous blocks above threshold, and the only “recovery” coming in the form of tempo efforts (but only after massive surges), you need to bring your A-game to make it through this one. Actually, bring your A+ game.

​

With so much time right at or above threshold you really push your ability to efficiently produce aerobic power to its limits, which is the key to a quality FTP session (when you are fresh). All that time above threshold, those large surges, and that inadequate recovery also punishes your Anaerobic Capacity (AC) and Maximal Aerobic Power (MAP) harder than other FTP-focused sessions.
